body:
Fixes https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/23359
Closes https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/15206

This takes inspiration from #15206 but makes use of `encodings.utf_8` to handle line-break parsing of bytestreams (assuming they are `utf-8`).

This adds an `open_utf8` function to `llnl.util.filesystem` that can open filenames or file descriptors for reading or writing.
title: utf8 support before py 37
